title: Baby shot in head, killed in Portsmouth
content:
PORTSMOUTH, Va (WVEC) -- Police are investigating a shooting that killed a 1-year-old boy and injured a woman Saturday night in Prentis Place.
Officers got a call about the shooting in the 1500 block of Maple Avenue around 9:30 p.m.
When police arrived, they found 1-year-old Dion Lofton, Jr. had a gunshot wound to the head.
A 25-year-old woman, who was a friend of Lofton's parents, had been hit in her lower back.
Medics took both to the hospital where Lofton died.
"He was just happiness for everybody," said Lofton's uncle, Michael Mosley. "It's just a hard thing to deal with."
Although the woman's injuries were serious, police expected her to survive.
Detectives arrested two people they believe were involved in the shooting.
18-year-old Anthony D. Holley of Portsmouth and 18-year-old Jerry Atkinson of Portsmouth are charged with first degree murder, aggravated malicious wounding, attempted robbery, and use of a firearm in the commission of a felony.
The two were arraigned Monday morning and are scheduled for a preliminary hearing on July 31.
(Photo: Portsmouth Police)
Holley and Atkinson remain in the custody of the Portsmouth Sheriff's Office.
